DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Topotecan hydrochloride is a chemotherapy drug that damages the DNA of cancer cells and other rapidly growing cells, causing them to die.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Topotecan hydrochloride is approved to be used alone or with other drugs to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Cervical cancer that has spread to other parts of the body, has come back, or cannot be cured with other therapy. It is used with cisplatin.
Ovarian cancer that has spread to other parts of the body. It is used alone in patients whose cancer got worse during or after other chemotherapy.
Small cell lung cancer that is platinum sensitive. It is used alone in patients whose cancer got worse after first-line chemotherapy.

Section.Para: Topotecan hydrochloride is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
